members.name: dynamic component
members.title: dynamic component
members.description: Dynamic component represents a reactive component

members.name: date
members.description: A date entity (without time)

members.name: datetime
members.description: A date and time entity

members.name: date format
members.description: A date time format defining how a date should be converted into a text field. See details for possible format parts at https://www.unicode.org/reports/tr35/tr35-dates.html#Date_Field_Symbol_Table

members.name: day of week
members.description: Days of week

members.name: stringy
members.description: This type can be used for any Javascript entity with a toString function, such as numbers.
members.title: text or number

members.name: string
members.description: This type correlates with the Javascript String type

members.name: div container
members.title: div container

props.title: properties
props.description: Specify the properties of the component

display.description: Set data to display in component, when to display it and how to reference it

ref.title: reference
ref.description: reference name used to reference and identify this component. The reference is used to identify the component so it should be descriptive. It may contain spaces.

style.description: Set style specification for the component such as font color and border style

classes.description: Specify which classes to apply to the component. Classes are combinations of style settings.

config.description: component configuration including style, classes, properties and events
config.title: component configuration

members.description: A plain div element that can be used as a container for other components and elements.

displayCondition.title: display condition
displayCondition.description: A condition determining if the component should be displayed. The component will only be displayed if the condition is true

members.name: plain page
members.title: page

props.title: properties
props.description: Specify the properties of the component

display.description: Set data to display in component, when to display it and how to reference it

ref.title: reference
ref.description: reference name used to reference and identify this component. The reference is used to identify the component so it should be descriptive. It may contain spaces.

style.description: Set style specification for the component such as font color and border style

classes.description: Specify which classes to apply to the component. Classes are combinations of style settings.

config.description: component configuration including style, classes, properties and events
config.title: component configuration

members.description: A plain page integrated into the app using the router

displayCondition.title: display condition
displayCondition.description: A condition determining if the component should be displayed. The component will only be displayed if the condition is true

members.name: repeater
members.title: repeater

props.title: properties
props.description: Specify the properties of the component

display.description: Set data to display in component, when to display it and how to reference it

ref.title: reference
ref.description: reference name used to reference and identify this component. The reference is used to identify the component so it should be descriptive. It may contain spaces.

style.description: Set style specification for the component such as font color and border style

classes.description: Specify which classes to apply to the component. Classes are combinations of style settings.

config.description: component configuration including style, classes, properties and events
config.title: component configuration

members.description: Repeat a block for each item in a collection.

displayCondition.title: display condition
displayCondition.description: A condition determining if the component should be displayed. The component will only be displayed if the condition is true

collection.description: data collection for the repeater. A block is generated for each data collection item

repeatComponent.description: the component to repeat for each data item
repeatComponent.title: repeat component

members.name: span text
members.title: text span

props.title: properties
props.description: Specify the properties of the component

display.description: Set data to display in component, when to display it and how to reference it

ref.title: reference
ref.description: reference name used to reference and identify this component. The reference is used to identify the component so it should be descriptive. It may contain spaces.

style.description: Set style specification for the component such as font color and border style

classes.description: Specify which classes to apply to the component. Classes are combinations of style settings.

config.description: component configuration including style, classes, properties and events
config.title: component configuration

members.description: A text span element that can be used for display of text.

displayCondition.title: display condition
displayCondition.description: A condition determining if the component should be displayed. The component will only be displayed if the condition is true

members.name: animation(style)
members.description: The animation CSS property is a shorthand property for animation-name , animation-duration , animation-timing-function , animation-delay , animation-iteration-count and animation-direction .
members.title: animation (style)

members.name: animation-delay(style)
members.description: The animation-delay CSS property specifies when the animation should start. This lets the animation sequence begin some time after it's applied to an element.
members.title: animation delay (style)

members.name: animation-direction(style)
members.description: The animation-direction CSS property indicates whether the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.
members.title: animation direction (style)

members.name: animation-duration(style)
members.description: The animation-duration CSS property specifies the length of time that an animation should take to complete one cycle.
members.title: animation duration (style)

members.name: animation-iteration-count(style)
members.description: The animation-iteration-count CSS property defines the number of times an animation cycle should be played before stopping.
members.title: animation iteration count (style)

members.name: animation-name(style)
members.description: The animation-name CSS property specifies a list of animations that should be applied to the selected element. Each name indicates a @keyframes at-rule that defines the property values for the animation sequence.
members.title: animation name (style)

members.name: animation-play-state(style)
members.description: The animation-play-state CSS property determines whether an animation is running or paused. You can query this property's value to determine whether or not the animation is currently running; in addition, you can set its value to pause and resume playback of an animation.
members.title: animation play state (style)

members.name: animation-timing-function(style)
members.description: The animation-timing-function CSS property specifies how a CSS animation should progress over the duration of each cycle. The possible values are one or several <timing-function> .
members.title: animation timing function (style)

members.name: azimuth(style)
members.description: In combination with elevation, azimuth enables different audio sources to be positioned spatially for aural presentation. This is important in that it provides a natural way to tell several voices apart, as each can be positioned to originate at a different location on the sound stage. Stereo output produce a lateral sound stage, while binaural headphones and multi-speaker setups allow for a fully three-dimensional stage.
members.title: azimuth (style)

members.name: backface-visibility(style)
members.description: The backface-visibility CSS property determines whether or not the back face of the element is visible when facing the user. The back face of an element always is a transparent background, letting, when visible, a mirror image of the front face be displayed.
members.title: backface visibility (style)

members.name: background(style)
members.description: The background CSS property is a shorthand for setting the individual background values in a single place in the style sheet. background can be used to set the values for one or more of: background-color , background-image , background-position , background-repeat , background-size , and background-attachment .
members.title: background (style)

members.name: background-attachment(style)
members.description: If a background-image is specified, the background-attachment CSS property determines whether that image's position is fixed within the viewport, or scrolls along with its containing block.
members.title: background attachment (style)

members.name: background-clip(style)
members.description: The background-clip CSS property specifies whether an element's background, either the color or image, extends underneath its border.
members.title: background clip (style)

members.name: background-color(style)
members.description: The background-color CSS property sets the background color of an element, either through a color value or the keyword transparent.
members.title: background color (style)

members.name: background-image(style)
members.description: The background-image CSS property sets the background images for an element. The images are drawn on successive stacking context layers, with the first specified being drawn as if it is the closest to the user. The borders of the element are then drawn on top of them, and the background-color is drawn beneath them.
members.title: background image (style)

members.name: background-origin(style)
members.description: The background-origin CSS property determines the background positioning area, that is the position of the origin of an image specified using the background-image CSS property.
members.title: background origin (style)

members.name: background-position(style)
members.description: The background-position CSS property sets the initial position, relative to the background position layer defined by background-origin for each defined background image.
members.title: background position (style)

members.name: background-repeat(style)
members.description: The background-repeat CSS property defines how background images are repeated. A background image can be repeated along the horizontal axis, the vertical axis, both, or not repeated at all. When the repetition of the image tiles doesn't let them exactly cover the background, the way adjustments are done can be controlled by the author: by default, the last image is clipped, but the different tiles can instead be re-sized, or space can be inserted between the tiles.
members.title: background repeat (style)

members.name: background-size(style)
members.description: The background-size CSS property specifies the size of the background images.
members.title: background size (style)

members.name: bleed(style)
members.description: This property specifies the extent of the page bleed area outside the page box. This property only has effect if crop marks are enabled.
members.title: bleed (style)

members.name: border(style)
members.description: The border CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual border property values in a single place in the style sheet. border can be used to set the values for one or more of: border-width , border-style , border-color .
members.title: border (style)

members.name: border-bottom(style)
members.description: The border-bottom CSS property is a shorthand that sets the values of border-bottom-color , border-bottom-style , and border-bottom-width . These properties describe the bottom border of elements.
members.title: border bottom (style)

members.name: border-bottom-color(style)
members.description: The border-bottom-color CSS property sets the color of the bottom border of an element. Note that in many cases the shorthand CSS properties  border-color or border-bottom are more convenient and preferable.
members.title: border bottom color (style)

members.name: border-bottom-left-radius(style)
members.description: The border-bottom-left-radius CSS property sets the rounding of the bottom-left corner of the element. The rounding can be a circle or an ellipse, or if one of the value is 0 no rounding is done and the corner is square.
members.title: border bottom left radius (style)

members.name: border-bottom-right-radius(style)
members.description: The border-bottom-right-radius CSS property sets the rounding of the bottom-right corner of the element. The rounding can be a circle or an ellipse, or if one of the value is 0 no rounding is done and the corner is square.
members.title: border bottom right radius (style)

members.name: border-bottom-style(style)
members.description: The border-bottom-style CSS property sets the line style of the bottom border of a box.
members.title: border bottom style (style)

members.name: border-bottom-width(style)
members.description: The border-bottom-width CSS property sets the width of the bottom border of a box.
members.title: border bottom width (style)

members.name: border-collapse(style)
members.description: The border-collapse CSS property selects a table's border model. This has a big influence on the look and style of the table cells.
members.title: border collapse (style)

members.name: border-color(style)
members.description: The border-color CSS property is a shorthand for setting the color of the four sides of an element's border: border-top-color , border-right-color , border-bottom-color , border-left-color
members.title: border color (style)

members.name: border-image(style)
members.description: The border-image CSS property allows drawing an image on the borders of elements. This makes drawing complex looking widgets much simpler than it has been and removes the need for nine boxes in some cases.
members.title: border image (style)

members.name: border-image-outset(style)
members.description: The border-image-outset property describes, by which amount border image area extends beyond the border box.
members.title: border image outset (style)

members.name: border-image-repeat(style)
members.description: The border-image-repeat CSS property defines how the middle part of a border image is handled to match the size of the border. It has a one-value syntax which describes the behavior for all sides, and a two-value syntax that sets a different value for the horizontal and vertical behavior.
members.title: border image repeat (style)

members.name: border-image-source(style)
members.description: The border-image-source CSS property defines the <image> to use instead of the style of the border. If this property is set to none, the style defined by border-style is used instead.
members.title: border image source (style)

members.name: border-image-width(style)
members.description: The border-image-width CSS property defines the offset to use for dividing the border image in nine parts, the top-left corner, central top edge, top-right-corner, central right edge, bottom-right corner, central bottom edge, bottom-left corner, and central right edge. They represent inward distance from the top, right, bottom and right edges.
members.title: border image width (style)

members.name: border-left(style)
members.description: The border-left CSS property is a shorthand that sets the values of border-left-color , border-left-style , and border-left-width . These properties describe the left border of elements.
members.title: border left (style)

members.name: border-left-color(style)
members.description: The border-left-color CSS property sets the color of the bottom border of an element. Note that in many cases the shorthand CSS properties  border-color or border-left are more convenient and preferable.
members.title: border left color (style)

members.name: border-left-style(style)
members.description: The border-left-style CSS property sets the line style of the left border of a box.
members.title: border left style (style)

members.name: border-left-width(style)
members.description: The border-left-width CSS property sets the width of the left border of a box.
members.title: border left width (style)

members.name: border-radius(style)
members.description: The border-radius CSS property allows Web authors to define how rounded border corners are. The curve of each corner is defined using one or two radii, defining its shape: circle or ellipse.
members.title: border radius (style)

members.name: border-right(style)
members.description: The border-right CSS property is a shorthand that sets the values of border-right-color , border-right-style , and border-right-width . These properties describe the right border of elements.
members.title: border right (style)

members.name: border-right-color(style)
members.description: The border-right-color CSS property sets the color of the bottom border of an element. Note that in many cases the shorthand CSS properties  border-color or border-right are more convenient and preferable.
members.title: border right color (style)

members.name: border-right-style(style)
members.description: The border-right-style CSS property sets the line style of the right border of a box.
members.title: border right style (style)

members.name: border-right-width(style)
members.description: The border-right-width CSS property sets the width of the right border of a box.
members.title: border right width (style)

members.name: border-spacing(style)
members.description: The border-spacing CSS property specifies the distance between the borders of adjacent cells (only for the separated borders model). This is equivalent to the cellspacing attribute in presentational HTML, but an optional second value can be used to set different horizontal and vertical spacing.
members.title: border spacing (style)

members.name: border-style(style)
members.description: The border-style CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the line style for all four sides of the elements border.
members.title: border style (style)

members.name: border-top(style)
members.description: The border-top CSS property is a shorthand that sets the values of border-top-color , border-top-style , and border-top-width . These properties describe the top border of elements.
members.title: border top (style)

members.name: border-top-color(style)
members.description: The border-top-color CSS property sets the color of the top border of an element. Note that in many cases the shorthand CSS properties  border-color or border-top are more convenient and preferable.
members.title: border top color (style)

members.name: border-top-left-radius(style)
members.description: The border-top-left-radius CSS property sets the rounding of the top-left corner of the element. The rounding can be a circle or an ellipse, or if one of the value is 0 no rounding is done and the corner is square.
members.title: border top left radius (style)

members.name: border-top-right-radius(style)
members.description: The border-top-right-radius CSS property sets the rounding of the top-right corner of the element. The rounding can be a circle or an ellipse, or if one of the value is 0 no rounding is done and the corner is square.
members.title: border top right radius (style)

members.name: border-top-style(style)
members.description: The border-top-style CSS property sets the line style of the top border of a box.
members.title: border top style (style)

members.name: border-top-width(style)
members.description: The border-top-width CSS property sets the width of the top border of a box.
members.title: border top width (style)

members.name: border-width(style)
members.description: The border-width CSS property sets the width of the border of a box. Using the shorthand property border is often more convenient.
members.title: border width (style)

members.name: bottom(style)
members.description: The bottom CSS property participates in specifying the position of positioned elements.
members.title: bottom (style)

members.name: box-shadow(style)
members.description: The box-shadow CSS property accepts one or more shadow effects as a comma-separated list. It allows casting a drop shadow from the frame of almost any element. If a border-radius is specified on the element with a box shadow, the box shadow takes on the same rounded corners. The z-ordering of multiple box shadows is the same as multiple text shadows (the first specified shadow is on top).
members.title: box shadow (style)

members.name: box-sizing(style)
members.description: The box-sizing CSS property is used to alter the default CSS box model used to calculate widths and heights of elements. It is possible to use this property to emulate the behavior of browsers that do not correctly support the CSS box model specification.
members.title: box sizing (style)

members.name: caption-side(style)
members.description: The caption-side CSS property positions the content of a table's <caption> on the specified side.
members.title: caption side (style)

members.name: clear(style)
members.description: The clear CSS property specifies whether an element can be next to floating elements that precede it or must be moved down (cleared) below them.
members.title: clear (style)

members.name: clip(style)
members.description: The clip CSS property defines what portion of an element is visible. The clip property applies only to elements with position:absolute .
members.title: clip (style)

members.name: color(style)
members.description: The color CSS property sets the foreground color of an element's text content
members.title: color (style)

members.name: column-count(style)
members.description: The column-count CSS property describes the number of columns of the element.
members.title: column count (style)

members.name: column-fill(style)
members.description: The column-fill CSS property controls how contents are partitioned into columns. Contents are either balanced, which means that contents in all columns will have the same height or, when using auto, just take up the room the content needs.
members.title: column fill (style)

members.name: column-gap(style)
members.description: The column-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap between columns for elements which are specified to display as a multi-column element.
members.title: column gap (style)

members.name: column-rule(style)
members.description: In multi-column layouts, the column-rule CSS property specifies a straight line, or "rule", to be drawn between each column. It is a convenient shorthand to avoid setting each of the individual column-rule-* properties separately : column-rule-width , column-rule-style and column-rule-color .
members.title: column rule (style)

members.name: column-rule-color(style)
members.description: The column-rule-color CSS property lets you set the color of the rule drawn between columns in multi-column layouts.
members.title: column rule color (style)

members.name: column-rule-style(style)
members.description: The column-rule-style CSS property lets you set the style of the rule drawn between columns in multi-column layouts.
members.title: column rule style (style)

members.name: column-rule-width(style)
members.description: The column-rule-width CSS property lets you set the width of the rule drawn between columns in multi-column layouts.
members.title: column rule width (style)

members.name: column-span(style)
members.description: The column-span CSS property makes it possible for an element to span across all columns when its value is set to all. An element that spans more than one column is called a spanning element.
members.title: column span (style)

members.name: column-width(style)
members.description: The column-width CSS property suggests an optimal column width. This is not a absolute value but a mere hint. Browser will adjust the width of the column around that suggested value, allowing to achieve scalable designs that fit different screen size. Especially in presence of the column-count CSS property which has precedence, to set an exact column width, all length values must be specified. In horizontal text these are width , column-width , column-gap , and column-rule-width .
members.title: column width (style)

members.name: columns(style)
members.description: The columns CSS property is a shorthand property allowing to set both the column-width and the column-count properties at the same time.
members.title: columns (style)

members.name: content(style)
members.description: The content CSS property is used with the :before and :after pseudo-elements to generate content in an element.
members.title: content (style)

members.name: counter-increment(style)
members.description: The counter-increment CSS property is used to increase the value of CSS Counters by a given value. The counter's value can be reset using the counter-reset CSS property.
members.title: counter increment (style)

members.name: counter-reset(style)
members.description: The counter-reset CSS property is used to reset CSS Counters to a given value.
members.title: counter reset (style)

members.name: cursor(style)
members.description: The cursor CSS property specifies the mouse cursor displayed when the mouse pointer is over an element.
members.title: cursor (style)

members.name: direction(style)
members.description: The direction CSS property should be set to match the direction of the text: rtl for Hebrew or Arabic text and ltr for other scripts. This should normally be done as part of the document (e.g., using the dir attribute in HTML) rather than through direct use of CSS.
members.title: direction (style)

members.name: display(style)
members.description: The display CSS property specifies the type of rendering box used for an element. In HTML, default display property values are taken from behaviors described in the HTML specifications or from the browser/user default stylesheet. The default value in XML is inline.
members.title: display (style)

members.name: empty-cells(style)
members.description: The empty-cells CSS property specifies how user agent should render borders and backgrounds around cells that have no visible content.
members.title: empty cells (style)

members.name: float(style)
members.description: The float CSS property specifies that an element should be taken from the normal flow and placed along the left or right side of its container, where text and inline elements will wrap around it.
members.title: float (style)

members.name: font(style)
members.description: The font CSS property is either a shorthand property for setting font-style , font-variant , font-weight , font-size , line-height and font-family , or a way to set the element's font to a system font, using specific keywords.
members.title: font (style)

members.name: font-family(style)
members.description: The font-family CSS property allows for a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names to be specified for the selected element. Unlike most other CSS properties, values are separated by a comma to indicate that they are alternatives. The browser will select the first font on the list that is installed on the computer, or that can be downloaded using the information provided by a @font-face at-rule.
members.title: font family (style)

members.name: font-size(style)
members.description: The font-size CSS property specifies the size of the font. The font size may, in turn, change the size of other items, since it is used to compute the value of em and ex length units.
members.title: font size (style)

members.name: font-size-adjust(style)
members.description: The font-size-adjust CSS property specifies that font size should be chosen based on the height of lowercase letters rather than the height of capital letters.
members.title: font size adjust (style)

members.name: font-stretch(style)
members.description: The font-stretch CSS property selects a normal, condensed, or extended face from a font family.
members.title: font stretch (style)

members.name: font-style(style)
members.description: The font-style CSS property allows italic or oblique faces to be selected within a font-family .
members.title: font style (style)

members.name: font-variant(style)
members.description: The font-variant CSS property selects a normal, or small-caps face from a font family. Setting font-variant is also possible by using the font shorthand.
members.title: font variant (style)

members.name: font-weight(style)
members.description: The font-weight CSS property specifies the weight or boldness of the font. However, some fonts are not available in all weights; some are available only on normal and bold.
members.title: font weight (style)

members.name: height(style)
members.description: The height CSS property specifies the height of the content area of an element. The content area is inside the padding, border, and margin of the element.
members.title: height (style)

members.name: hyphens(style)
members.description: The hyphens CSS property tells the browser how to go about splitting words to improve the layout of text when line-wrapping.
members.title: hyphens (style)

members.name: image-rendering(style)
members.description:
The image-rendering CSS property provides a hint to the user agent about how to handle its image rendering.
image-rendering applies to scaled images (and other elements, see below). For example, if the natural size of the image is 100100px but the page author specifies the dimensions to 200200px (or5050px), then the image will be upscaled (or downscaled) to the new dimensions using the specified algorithm. Scaling may also apply due to user interaction (zooming).
members.title: image rendering (style)

members.name: left(style)
members.description: The left CSS property specifies part of the position of positioned elements.
members.title: left (style)

members.name: letter-spacing(style)
members.description: The letter-spacing CSS property specifies spacing behavior between text characters.
members.title: letter spacing (style)

members.name: line-height(style)
members.description:
On inline elements, the line-height CSS property specifies the height that is used in the calculation of the line box height.
On block level elements, line-height specifies the minimal height of line boxes within the element.
members.title: line height (style)

members.name: list-style(style)
members.description: The list-style CSS property is a shorthand property for setting list-style-type , list-style-image and list-style-position .
members.title: list style (style)

members.name: list-style-image(style)
members.description: The list-style-image CSS property sets the image that will be used as the list item marker. It is often more convenient to use the shortcut list-style .
members.title: list style image (style)

members.name: list-style-position(style)
members.description: The list-style-position CSS property specifies the position of the marker box in the principal block box. It is often more convenient to use the shortcut list-style .
members.title: list style position (style)

members.name: list-style-type(style)
members.description: The list-style-type CSS property specifies appearance of a list item element. As it is the only one who defaults to display:list-item, this is usually a <li> element, but can be any element with this display value.
members.title: list style type (style)

members.name: margin(style)
members.description:
The margin CSS property sets the margin for all four sides. It is a shorthand to avoid setting each side separately with the other margin properties:
margin-top , margin-right , margin-bottom and margin-left .
Negative value are also allowed.
members.title: margin (style)

members.name: margin-bottom(style)
members.description: The margin-bottom CSS property of an element sets the margin space required on the bottom of an element. A negative value is also allowed.
members.title: margin bottom (style)

members.name: margin-left(style)
members.description: The margin-left CSS property of an element sets the margin space required on the left side of an element. A negative value is also allowed.
members.title: margin left (style)

members.name: margin-right(style)
members.description: The margin-right CSS property of an element sets the margin space required on the right side of an element. A negative value is also allowed.
members.title: margin right (style)

members.name: margin-top(style)
members.description: The margin-top CSS property of an element sets the margin space required on the top of an element. A negative value is also allowed.
members.title: margin top (style)

members.name: marker-offset(style)
members.title: marker offset (style)

members.name: marks(style)
members.description: The marks CSS property adds crop and/or cross marks to the presentation of the document. Crop marks indicate where the page should be cut. Cross marks are used to align sheets.
members.title: marks (style)

members.name: max-height(style)
members.description: The max-height CSS property is used to set the maximum height of a given element. It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming larger than the value specified for max-height.
members.title: max height (style)

members.name: max-width(style)
members.description: The max-width CSS property is used to set the maximum width of a given element. It prevents the used value of the width property from becoming larger than the value specified for max-width.
members.title: max width (style)

members.name: min-height(style)
members.description: The min-height CSS property is used to set the minimum height of a given element. It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-height.
members.title: min height (style)

members.name: min-width(style)
members.description: The min-width CSS property is used to set the minimum width of a given element. It prevents the used value of the width property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-width.
members.title: min width (style)

members.name: opacity(style)
members.description: The opacity CSS property specifies the transparency of an element, that is, the degree to which the background behind the element is overlaid.
members.title: opacity (style)

members.name: orphans(style)
members.description: The orphans CSS property refers to the minimum number of lines in a block container that must be left at the bottom of the page.  This property is normally used to control how page breaks occur.
members.title: orphans (style)

members.name: outline(style)
members.description: The outline CSS property is a shorthand property for setting one or more of the individual outline properties outline-style , outline-width and outline-color in a single rule. In most cases the use of this shortcut is preferable and more convenient.
members.title: outline (style)

members.name: outline-color(style)
members.description: The outline-color CSS property sets the color of the outline of an element. An outline is a line that is drawn around elements, outside the border edge, to make the element stand out.
members.title: outline color (style)

members.name: outline-offset(style)
members.description: The outline-offset CSS property is used to set space between an outline and the edge or border of an element. An outline is a line that is drawn around elements, outside the border edge.
members.title: outline offset (style)

members.name: outline-style(style)
members.description: The outline-style CSS property is used to set the style of the outline of an element. An outline is a line that is drawn around elements, outside the border edge, to make the element stand out.
members.title: outline style (style)

members.name: outline-width(style)
members.description: The outline-width CSS property is used to set the width of the outline of an element. An outline is a line that is drawn around elements, outside the border edge, to make the element stand out:
members.title: outline width (style)

members.name: overflow(style)
members.description: The overflow CSS property specifies whether to clip content, render scroll bars or display overflow content of a block-level element.
members.title: overflow (style)

members.name: overflow-x(style)
members.description: The overflow-x CSS property specifies whether to clip content, render a scroll bar or display overflow content of a block-level element, when it overflows at the left and right edges.
members.title: overflow x (style)

members.name: padding(style)
members.description: The padding CSS property sets the required padding space on all sides of an element. The padding area is the space between the content of the element and its border. Negative values are not allowed.
members.title: padding (style)

members.name: padding-bottom(style)
members.description: The padding-bottom CSS property of an element sets the padding space required on the bottom of an element. The padding area is the space between the content of the element and it's border. A negative value is not allowed.
members.title: padding bottom (style)

members.name: padding-left(style)
members.description: The padding-left CSS property of an element sets the padding space required on the left side of an element. The padding area is the space between the content of the element and it's border. A negative value is not allowed.
members.title: padding left (style)

members.name: padding-right(style)
members.description: The padding-right CSS property of an element sets the padding space required on the right side of an element. The padding area is the space between the content of the element and its border. Negative values are not allowed.
members.title: padding right (style)

members.name: padding-top(style)
members.description: The padding-top CSS property of an element sets the padding space required on the top of an element. The padding area is the space between the content of the element and it's border. A negative values is not allowed.
members.title: padding top (style)

members.name: page-break-after(style)
members.description: The page-break-after CSS property adjusts page breaks after the current element.
members.title: page break after (style)

members.name: page-break-before(style)
members.description: The page-break-before CSS property adjusts page breaks before the current element.
members.title: page break before (style)

members.name: page-break-inside(style)
members.description: The page-break-inside CSS property adjusts page breaks inside the current element.
members.title: page break inside (style)

members.name: perspective(style)
members.description: The perspective CSS property determines the distance between the z=0 plane and the user in order to give to the 3D-positioned element some perspective. Each 3D element that is placed between the z=0 and the user is enlarged, each 3D-element with z<0 is shrinked. How much deformation is defined by the value of this property.
members.title: perspective (style)

members.name: perspective-origin(style)
members.description: The perspective-origin CSS property determines the position the viewer is looking at. It is used as the vanishing point by the perspective property.
members.title: perspective origin (style)

members.name: position(style)
members.description: The position CSS property chooses alternative rules for positioning elements, designed to be useful for scripted animation effects.
members.title: position (style)

members.name: quotes(style)
members.description: The quotes CSS property indicates how user agents should render quotation marks.
members.title: quotes (style)

members.name: resize(style)
members.description: The resize CSS property lets you control the resizability of an element.
members.title: resize (style)

members.name: right(style)
members.description: The right CSS property specifies part of the position of positioned elements.
members.title: right (style)

members.name: tab-size(style)
members.description: The tab-size CSS property is used to customize the width of a tab (U+0009) character.
members.title: tab size (style)

members.name: table-layout(style)
members.description: The table-layout CSS property defines the algorithm to be used to layout the table cells, rows, and columns.
members.title: table layout (style)

members.name: text-align(style)
members.description: The text-align CSS property describes how inline content like text is aligned in its parent block element. text-align does not control the alignment of block elements itself, only their inline content.
members.title: text align (style)

members.name: text-align-last(style)
members.description: The text-align-last CSS property describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned.
members.title: text align last (style)

members.name: text-decoration(style)
members.description: The text-decoration CSS property is used to set the text formattings underline, overline, line-through and blink.
members.title: text decoration (style)

members.name: text-decoration-color(style)
members.description: The text-decoration-color CSS property sets the color used when drawing underlines, overlines, or strike-throughs specified by text-decoration-line . This is the preferred way to color these text decorations, rather than using combinations of other HTML elements.
members.title: text decoration color (style)

members.name: text-decoration-line(style)
members.description: The text-decoration-line CSS property sets what kind of line decorations are added to an element.
members.title: text decoration line (style)

members.name: text-decoration-style(style)
members.description: The text-decoration-style CSS property defines the style of the lines specified by text-decoration-line . The style applies to all lines, there is no way to define different style for each of the line defined by text-decoration-line.
members.title: text decoration style (style)

members.name: text-indent(style)
members.description: The text-indent CSS property specifies how much horizontal space should be left before beginning of the first line of the text content of an element. Horizontal spacing is with respect to the left (or right, for right-to-left layout) edge of the containing block element's box.
members.title: text indent (style)

members.name: text-shadow(style)
members.description: The text-shadow CSS property adds shadows to text. It accepts a comma-separated list of shadows to be applied to the text and text-decorations of the element.
members.title: text shadow (style)

members.name: text-transform(style)
members.description: The text-transform CSS property specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.
members.title: text transform (style)

members.name: top(style)
members.description: The top CSS property specifies part of the position of positioned elements. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.
members.title: top (style)

members.name: transform(style)
members.description: The transform CSS property lets you modify the coordinate space of the CSS visual formatting model. Using it, elements can be translated, rotated, scaled, and skewed according to the values set.
members.title: transform (style)

members.name: transform-origin(style)
members.description: The transform-origin CSS property lets you modify the origin for transformations of an element. For example, the transform-origin of the rotate() function is the centre of rotation. (This property is applied by first translating the element by the negated value of the property, then applying the element's transform, then translating by the property value.)
members.title: transform origin (style)

members.name: transform-style(style)
members.description: The transform-style CSS property determines if the children of the element are positioned in the 3D-space or are flattened in the plane of the element.
members.title: transform style (style)

members.name: transition(style)
members.description: The transition CSS property is a shorthand property for transition-property , transition-duration , transition-timing-function , and transition-delay .
members.title: transition (style)

members.name: transition-delay(style)
members.description: The transition-delay CSS property specifies the amount of time to wait between a change being requested to a property that is to be transitioned and the start of the transition effect.
members.title: transition delay (style)

members.name: transition-duration(style)
members.description: The transition-duration CSS property specifies the number of seconds or milliseconds a transition animation should take to complete. By default, the value is 0s, meaning that no animation will occur.
members.title: transition duration (style)

members.name: transition-property(style)
members.description: The transition-property CSS property is used to specify the names of CSS properties to which a transition effect should be applied.
members.title: transition property (style)

members.name: transition-timing-function(style)
members.description: The transition-timing-function CSS property is used to describe how the intermediate values of the CSS properties being affected by a transition effect are calculated. This in essence lets you establish an acceleration curve, so that the speed of the transition can vary over its duration.
members.title: transition timing function (style)

members.name: vertical-align(style)
members.description: The vertical-align CSS property specifies the vertical alignment of an inline or table-cell element.
members.title: vertical align (style)

members.name: visibility(style)
members.description: The visibility CSS property is used for two things:
members.title: visibility (style)

members.name: white-space(style)
members.description: The white-space CSS property is used to to describe how whitespace inside the element is handled.
members.title: white space (style)

members.name: widows(style)
members.description: where:
members.title: widows (style)

members.name: width(style)
members.description: The width CSS property specifies the width of the content area of an element. The content area is inside the padding, border, and margin of the element.
members.title: width (style)

members.name: word-spacing(style)
members.description: The word-spacing CSS property specifies spacing behavior between tags and words.
members.title: word spacing (style)

members.name: word-wrap(style)
members.description: The word-wrap CSS property is used to to specify whether or not the browser is allowed to break lines within words in order to prevent overflow when an otherwise unbreakable string is too long to fit.
members.title: word wrap (style)

members.name: z-index(style)
members.description: The z-index CSS property specifies the z-order of an element and its descendants. When elements overlap, z-order determines which one covers the other. An element with a larger z-index generally covers an element with a lower one.
members.title: z index (style)

members.name: front end script
members.description: Provide a front end script that is dynamiclly rendered on the client

data.title: data
data.description: define the data entities to use in the app. These entities will be stored in the database

packages.title: packages
packages.description: packages to use - list of packages to use in this script. Each package encapsulates some functionality. This is similar to npm packages

extensions.title: extensions
extensions.description: Extensions add functionality to the web application

subPages.title: sub pages
subPages.description: child pages of this page, displayed as part of the page using the url router

members.name: clear value
members.description: clear a value of a property or variable - setting it to undefined
members.title: clear value

members.name: do nothing
members.description: This is a dummy action that can be used to signal that an event does not cause action rather than the action was not set yet.

members.name: open link
members.description: Open a url. Make sure to start with http or https for URL's in other websites (non-relative link)

newWindow.title: new window
newWindow.description: open url in a new window
newWindow.placeholder: true for opening in new window

members.title: open url

members.name: focus on component
members.description: Focus on the specified component.
members.title: focus on ...

members.name: length
members.description: length of an object

members.name: size
members.description: size of an object

members.name: orientation
members.description: orientation of an object

members.name: starts with

members.description: Test if the text starts with the beginning text

beginning.title: beginning
beginning.description: The required beginning of the text

members.title: starts with

members.name: ends with
members.subject: string
members.description: Test if the text ends with the ending text

ending.title: ending
ending.description: The required ending of the text

members.title: ends with

members.name: includes
members.subject: string
members.description: Test if the text includes the text fragment text

textFragment.title: text fragment
textFragment.description: A fragment the text should include

members.title: text includes

members.name: string is equal
members.subject: string
members.description: Compare the text to another text
members.title: is equal to ...

members.name: string is not equal
members.subject: string
members.description: Compare the text to another text
members.title: is not equal to ...

members.name: is one of
members.subject: any
members.description: Test if the text is one of the following texts

texts.title: texts
texts.description: list of text items to test for

members.title: one of

members.name: is not one of
members.subject: string
members.description: Test if the text is not one of the following texts

texts.title: texts
texts.description: list of text items to test for

members.title: not one of

members.name: is string empty
members.subject: string
members.description: Test if a string is empty. If the value is undefined or null then the value is considered empty
members.title: is empty

members.name: now
members.description: Current time and date
members.title: now

members.name: today
members.description: Current date
members.title: today

members.name: now as text
members.description: Current date and time in textual format

members.name: today as text
members.description: Today in textual format

members.name: part of day greeting
members.description: One of the following greetings based on the time of day: Good morning, Good afternoon, Good evening

members.name: date as text
members.description: A date formated using current locale format or a specified date format
members.title: date as text

members.name: datetime as text
members.description: A time and date expressed using textual format
members.title: time as text

members.name: date value
members.description: Specify a specific date
members.title: specific date

members.name: random integer
members.description: Select a random number between `from` and `to` (not inclusive).

from.title: from
from.description: lowest possible random number - default is 0

members.title: random integer

members.name: random number
members.description: Select a random number in the range of 0 and less than 1.
members.title: random number (0..1)

members.name: square root
members.description: Calculate the square root of a number
members.title: square root

members.name: max number
members.description: Find the largest of the numbers in the list

numbers.title: numbers
numbers.description: a list of numbers to evaluate

members.title: max number

members.name: min number
members.description: Find the smallest of the numbers in the list

numbers.title: numbers
numbers.description: a list of numbers to evaluate

members.title: min number

members.name: round
members.description: Calculate the value of the number rounded to the nearest integer.
members.title: round number

members.name: join string
members.description: Join a sequence of texts into a single text. This can be used to create a text out of several expressions. This expression eliminates all null or undefined items fromthe array.

arr.title: texts
arr.description: A list of text expressions to join - concatenate

sep.title: separator
sep.description: A text to use to join all texts. Default is am empty string i.e. the texts are joined with a single space

members.title: join text list

members.name: predefined text
members.description: A predefined text
members.title: predefined text

members.name: text after text
members.description: Search for a text fragment and calculate the text starting after that fragment. If the fragment is not found within text then the value is an empty string
members.title: text after text

members.name: text before text
members.description: Search for a text fragment and calculate the text before that fragment. If the fragment is not found within text then the value is the complete text
members.title: text before text

members.name: trimmed
members.description: Trim a text, removing whitespace from beginning and end
members.title: trim text

members.name: number as text
members.description: Converts a number to text
members.title: number as text

members.name: get device size
members.description: The device size is defined based on the bootstrap brakpoints. It can be used to customize the display based on device size.
